name: almond production | almond | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15756/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of almonds. The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 2.9 t/ha. The data are representative for almond production in China used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 103-30-29 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 11.1 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of almonds produced in China amounts to 17% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing almonds produced in China for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 3.0 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with the nursery producing tree seedlings, i.e. grafted young trees to be planted.

This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard (rooting up the trees). The dataset includes all activities of a year in a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (29 years, 249 trees/ha planted), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase.
The productive phase of the orchard includes machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation (mulching, mowing), fertiliser and pesticide application, prune, harvesting and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared by rooting up the trees.

Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. 
Statistical data from FAO used to assess land use change is incomplete for China. The original land use of 40.9% of annual cropland and 100% of perennial cropland transformed in the last 20 years is unknown. Land use change impacts may therefore be underestimated.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0125:Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L1; Irrigation: L2. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of almond is calculated to be circa 3.80E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[sulfonyl]urea-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'glyphosate', 'nitrile-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'zinc'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 7.60E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - 100% emission in soil. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

5.13226788953e-07 from Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
-9.58029430889e-08 from Crop, default, heavy metals uptake model
Heavy metal uptake can be excluded by setting the parameter heavyMetalUptakeSwitch to zero.
Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports. This emission might be overestimated in case of basic soils.

Proxy: Source for total amount of pesticides: extrapolated from MEXALCA. Active ingredient is calculated based on Ecoinvent dataset Almonds US. For calculations see supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description: Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

On-farm transport: Yield (in tonnes) multiplied by the average distance from field to farm. The distance was obtained by extrapolation (modified MEXALCA approach). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Machinery processes' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Corresponds to 11.2tkm/ha.
